column5: Sorry to see Christine and Remi sell all but two (Melchett & Kayedon) of their camps. They feel it is time for them to slow down, and feel two camps are the right number for Remi to take care of. Remi likes to fly his own plane and this gives him an excuse to keep the plane and keep flying. Best of luck in whatever the future brings.
I've never used them but have heard lots of positive things over the years. Any idea who bought the other camps? Adam, Mike? The Opichuan camp on Kag has been on my radar for a while.

Seven Lakes Wilderness Camps acquired Kap, Kag and Wayner.I am fairly sure Meta Lake Lodge picked up the outpost on Meta Lake.You already know about the two Eddie North's acquired.Not sure where Makoki is yet though. Maybe nobody, maybe Twin Lakes? No clue really.
I am sure Makoki was sold to be used as a private camp. This was the first lake I went to with AWO. Small but productive.
Makoki was sold privately about 4yrs ago. Beautiful lake with boat access. I thought 7 Lakes had gotten Meta also, maybe not.
Thanks for the info on Makoki. I have no idea if Seven Lakes had Meta or not, but it's definitely in the hands of Meta Lake Lodge now. They also acquired the AMS camp on Meta.
